definitions.definition: to arrive at a place, especially after spending a long time or a lot of effort travelling:
examples: We won't reach Miami until five or six o'clock.

definitions.definition: to make a decision, agreement, etc. about something:
examples: She reached the conclusion that there was no more she could do.

definitions.definition: Your reach is the distance within which you can stretch out your arm and touch something:
examples: I like to keep a notebook and pencil within (arm's) reach.

definitions.definition: the distance that can be travelled, especially easily:
examples: We live within (easy) reach of the station.

definitions.definition: the length of your arm when you stretch it out:
examples: You've got quite a long reach - can you get that box down from the top shelf for me?

definitions.definition: an act of stretching out your arm:
examples: He made a sudden reach for his gun.
